instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
It was water damaged. closed to ISL, changed it and worked fine except battery not detected. Found
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>=3.4V both side, <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>=3.4v both side. Checked BIL looks good. Any help please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Check traces and solders for pins 10/11 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Post resistance to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Also post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
traces and solders for pins 10/11 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. looks good.
resistance to ground at SCL=.455 and sdl=.456
exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.4 v .Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Bad SMC, or battery in this case.
I would test a known good battery first.
Also recommend you try another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Last solution, change the SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message: Try another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>  and now see no green light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Bad solders I suppose.
Post again the values mentioned before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=.0.5v
resistance to ground at SCL=.462  and sdl=.461

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Yeah, something happened when you changed <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Check all solders and be sure didn't knock off any component.
Post volatge for pins 1, 2, 3, 12, 13, 14, 9, 15, 19, 20, 28.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 (ohm mode).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Checked all solders looks very good and no missing any components.
Voltage of ISL
pin1=0v
pin2=16.58v
pin3=3.95v
pin9=0v
pin12=1.1v
pin13=0.8v
pin14=0.8v
pin15=0v
pin19=5v
pin20=5v
pin28=16.46v

Registance ( ohm mode) betw pins 17/18=2.9 ohm
Registance ( ohm mode) betw pins 27/28=20 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
"pin12=1.1v"
Bad value for 3V42.
Post voltages for <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Volteges for <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>:
PIN9 P3V42G3H=1.1V
PIN8 <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_FB</SIGNAL>= 4.9V
PIN7 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>=16.6V
PIN6 <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_SW</SIGNAL>=1.1V
PIN4 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>=16.6V
PIN3 <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_TON</SIGNAL>=11/12 NOT STABLE
PIN2 <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_FB</SIGNAL>=4.9V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message:
Check resistance to ground (diode mode) at L6995.
If good, check <CAPACITOR>C6991</CAPACITOR>/96 and <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>.
If all good, change <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>.
Be sure all traces and solders are OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, battery not detected
threads.message: Changed <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and now see the green light and battery also detected , all tested passed. Thanks for your help.
